page.title: 14CHANGING TIMES.
page.content: There have been great changes in Berk- hamsted within living memory.These are mainly conneted with the expansion of the town. Senior citizens recall fields and allotments where there are now homes and schools. In many instances, such as Barncroft, one large house has been replaced by twenty or more new houses. Co-op horses once grazed where Greenway School now stands. The enormous increase traffic has altered the atmosphere of the town. Sixty years ago, horse drawn carts and bicycles thronged the High Street, which is now crowded with cars, vans, trucks and tankers. Older residents remember playing with hoops, spinning tops and home made scooters on the roads where children and adults now have to cross the road with great care. The future bypass may quieten the town.
